text: Yeah, that's true. Even at this moment I try to convince her. And I just got a friend with me who actually loves the game just as I do. :D Well, I hope I can do this. ^^
author: Gergő Gyalus

text:
I don't think your english is that bad actually.
I understand wholly the whole games in "our world" thing, I feel the same way.
Your friend needs to be a bit more open to possibilities is all I can say. It'd be nice if all language patches could exist for every game but some languages are bound to be more popular, can't let that keep you from something you could possibly enjoy. I'll even use broken Google translate if need be. XD
author: Arc13

text: And she just said why: "Look, my English is not that good, this is why I don't really watch the story of english games, the only exception is that if it has a Hungarian patch." I've just told her that not only graphics are gameplay, the gameplay is the story, the world you could "live in", the fantasy part of it, the possibilities. (Sorry I don't really like games which are about "our world" (GTA, L.A Noire, etc.)) But no, never wants to give it a try. -.-" WHY, WHYYYYY?????????
author: Gergő Gyalus

text: I know that, I was just wanted to tell her that she must PLAY the game before she judges. She only judged about the trailer video and the pictures of it. I just don't know how can someone hate the game because of the graphics or anything else... No one can hate this game, I mean that it's a brilliant game and nobody can judge it before he/she played it. It was about 3 weeks ago, still then I just want to tell her that to JUST give it a try. But no. (sorry for my bad English, I'm from Hungary.)
author: Gergő Gyalus

text:
Well I'm sorry to say, but your friend's ability to judge quality is absolutely terrible. Horrendous. Unless your friend can see the future, raise the dead, walk on water, loves Chrono Trigger, or has spoken with God about possibly being the next incarnation of Jesus himself, I'm not sure if I personally would trust a single opinion of theirs if to dictate a game they go solely on graphics and they deem cell shading as instant "ugly".
Because that is a terrible judge of quality.
author: Arc13

text:
Well, a friend of mine doesn't want to play it because "the graphics are ugly".
That was very bad for me to hear this, it's my childhood favourite. :') Even today when I play it, if I see the Lighthouse, Pey'j, or when I can drive the hovercraft on the sea of Hyllis, I'm jst smiling and remembering that wow, the best game I played ever. The only game what I can't find boring... Since 2005. (Yes, I only played the game first in 2005) Those good old times. Hyllis, what I can call "my second home".

text:
Man, I can't tell you how often I see loads of used copies of this sitting around for $8 each. And how no one buys them is beyond me.
As to the sequel, it is VERY possible. For god's sake we're in the reinventing/FPS/sandbox generation! Rocket Knight got redone, Megaman, Punch Out!!, I've actually posted a similar comment elsewhere as well. Point is, no series is ever truly dead. Gaming series as a whole are about 30 years old, so if 20 year old games are returning, this one definetly will too.
